headline: Why Are AppLovin (APP) Shares Soaring Today
summary: Shares of mobile app technology company AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) jumped 5.3% in the afternoon session after Deutsche Bank initiated coverage of the mobile adtech company with a 'buy' rating.

summary: APP's Axon rebrand marks a bold leap into AI-driven performance marketing, with surging revenue and expanding e-commerce ad reach.

headline: October 2025's Leading Growth Stocks With Strong Insider Ownership
summary: As U.S. stock indices reach new heights following a tamer-than-expected inflation report, investors are increasingly focused on growth companies with strong insider ownership, which can signal confidence and alignment with shareholder interests. In this thriving market environment, such stocks may offer compelling opportunities for those looking to align their portfolios with management's vested interests in the company's success.

headline: S&P 500 Adds Dicey Stocks as Market Turns Increasingly Exuberant
summary: The mobile advertising technology company’s shares have soared more than 5,500% since the end of 2022, making them the second best performer in the massive Russell 3000 Index, after Carvana Co. Its market capitalization is now more than $200 billion, up from $29 billion when it went public in April 2021.  Not surprisingly, it was added to the S&P 500 Index last month.  Short sellers accused AppLovin of ad fraud, illicitly tracking children and having deeper-than-disclosed links to Chinese entities.

headline: Oppenheimer Keeps Outperform Rating on AppLovin (APP) After Reports of SEC Probe
summary: AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) is one of the 10 Best American AI Stocks to Buy According to Analysts. On October 7, Oppenheimer reaffirmed its Outperform rating on AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) with a price target of $740. This decision comes after reports of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) probing AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) over its data-collection practices. […]

headline: High Insider Ownership Growth Stocks To Watch In October 2025
summary: As the U.S. stock market faces downward pressure amid ongoing U.S.-China trade tensions and mixed earnings reports, investors are closely monitoring growth companies with high insider ownership. In such volatile times, stocks with significant insider investment can signal confidence from those closest to the business, making them intriguing options for those seeking stability and potential growth in uncertain markets.

headline: 1 S&P 500 Stock to Own for Decades and 2 We Question
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is often seen as a benchmark for strong businesses, but that doesn’t mean every stock is worth owning. Some companies face significant challenges, whether it’s stagnating growth, heavy debt, or disruptive new competitors.
